result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Amy L Hill was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Modifier-Alcohol Conc. (.17-.199)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:00 pm - (w/ 14TR5148-59) - Def in court w/Atty Nathan Steven Schnick.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Ct. 1 - OWI 4th -  Guilty
remaining charges, 14TR5148-49 are dismissed and read in
SNP filed/signed/understands
  Plea Quest filed/signed/understands
Understands const rights waived
Understands elements of crime
No promises/threats
No alc/drugs/meds in the last 24 hrs  
acknowledges prior convictions
Actual BAC was .179
Plea is F, V & I made. Sufficient factual basis to support the plea and the def is found guilty.
KELLIS: ask to adopt the recommendations in the SNP. She's pretty close to getting an OWI every 2 yrs every 6-8 yrs. OWI court would be beneficial. At this rate if she gets another; w/ her hx we are looking at a great deal of incarceratin if she gets another. SCHNICK: She's been on bond for a yr and hasn't had a violation. She was living near her parents, had easy child care and could go out and drink at work. but she's now living in IA and going to school and doesn't have the social life that she had b/f. Agree that the 6 mos is approp but ask the court to consider her to con't work at the pizza place as they serve alc. DEF: I feel like I"m a different person from then to now. I have my life in order. Trying to do the best for my kids. CRT: Some period of probation would be beneficial.
SENTENCE
sentence withheld - 12 mos probation'
Con: $1694.00 - apply bond; 6 moc CJ - JOC to reflect crt approval of EM if the Sheriff's dept sees fit to convert the jail to EM; complete the OWI trmt court; AODA and comply w/ recommendations; 36 mos rev w/ IID for 36 mos; no alc; no bars/taverns but she can be in the bar that she works for employment only; not to op MV unless prop licenses; random testing. Any conditions DOC deems approp. 
No credit - 48 hrs to begin immediately - report to JSS after court and then to jail
$25.00 blood draw 
dsp, asmt
EXT: def to pay $50/mo eff 11/1/15 or CJ

Conditions:    Do not operate a motor vehicle until properly reinstated in Wisconsin.  Do not consume any alcohol.  No bars or taverns.    That the defendant shall report to Chemical Health & Justice Sanctions, located at 333 Vine St, La Crosse, WI, as soon after the defendant is released from jail, and if the release occurs while Chemical Health and Justice Sanctions is closed, then no later than 10:00 am on the next day, and comply with all directive concerning testing to assure abstinence from alcohol and drugs or controlled substances, if those substances were involved as well
